march.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if soldiers or other people march somewhere, they walk there quickly with firm regular steps
march.translation[0].definitions[0].note: Quick march! (=an order to tell people to start marching)
march.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: On 29 August the royal army marched into Inverness.
We marched 50 km across the foothills.
He gathered his troops and prepared to march on the capital  (=march to the capital in order to attack it).
march.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if a large group of people march somewhere, they walk there together to express their ideas or protest about something
march.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: An estimated 5,000 people marched through the city to demonstrate against the factory closures.
Outraged citizens marched on City Hall  (=marched to City Hall), demanding the police chief’s resignation.
march.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to walk somewhere quickly and with determination, often because you are angry
march.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Brett marched out of the office, slamming the door behind him.
march.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to force someone to walk somewhere with you, often pushing or pulling them roughly
march.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Mr Carter marched us to the principal’s office.
march.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an organized event in which many people walk together to express their ideas or protest about something
march.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The police decided not to ban the march.
I went on a lot of peace marches when I was a student.
march.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: when soldiers walk with firm regular steps from one place to another
march.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The general led his forces on a long march southwards.
march.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a piece of music for people to march to
march.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the third month of the year, between February and April
march.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: She started work here last March.
I wrote to my bank on 6th March.
The hospital is scheduled to open March 6.
